task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the goal region, approach and align the end-effector for a lateral push, execute several short pushes toward the goal, verify goal proximity, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top robot with a cylindrical end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace into a marked target region. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, careful approach to establish tangential contact, and repeated short pushes along a straight line. Visual frames show a red T-block and a drawn blue mark on the table used as the target cue. The controller operates at 10 Hz; timeouts are binned. No grasping is required—only planar pushing with yaw set to align the tool’s face to the intended motion.
preconditions: Workspace is clear around the T-block
Camera provides views of block and goal mark
End-effector is free and above the table
Block is movable on the surface
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and align for pushing
Set yaw to align with push direction
Execute repeated short pushes toward the goal
Verify the block reached the goal vicinity
success_criteria: T-block is inside or clearly touching the goal region boundary
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry perception up to three times
If pushing stalls, repeat short pushes; re-approach if misaligned
If verification fails, re-perceive and continue pushing
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after verification succeeds and the robot retreats from contact.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Hover above block to prepare push.
Slide into tangential contact with precise alignment.
Align tool yaw with push direction.

recovery_strategy: Re-approach and realign then continue pushes
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue target mark; instruction mentions gray block and green target with blue end-effector—we prioritize the frames
Goal direction assumed approximately left-to-right; yaw=0 and direction_deg=0 used

expected_success_criteria: Block overlaps goal mark when verification runs
